title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Friday, 8 April 2016 - BBC News
summary: a man who attacked his ex-girlfriend with an axe has been jailed for 20 years for attempted murder .
candidates for the region 's police and crime commissioner positions have been announced .
thames valley police officers have been given special powers to insist people remove any items used to conceal their identity at an english defence league protest tomorrow .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thank you for joining us today - we 've had everything from newborn bear cubs to the news of an aylesbury man being jailed for attempted murder .
if you 've missed anything please do scroll through the stream below .
otherwise , we 'll be back again at 08:00 on monday .
have a good weekend .

documents.title: blues re-sign four new players ahead of 2016/17 season
text: bedford blues ' recruitment for the 2016/17 season has continued with the re-signings of dean adamson , michael le bourgeois , mike howard and paul tupai .
adamson , 22 , scored 16 tries this season , while le bourgeois , 25 , has impressed since joining in 2013 .
lock howard , 30 , is another essential member of the squad , while 41-year-old tupai shows no sign of slowing down as he prepares for his 24th season in professional rugby .
blues director of rugby mike rayer said : `` i 'm delighted to have four more key players signed up for the next campaign . ''

documents.title: weather : scattered showers fading away
text: any scattered showers will gradually fade away this evening to leave most places dry for a time with clear intervals .
maximum temperature : 5c ( 41f ) .
saturday will start cloudy with outbreaks of rain , gradually clearing eastwards to leave a mixture of sunny spells and scattered showers .
highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
our was taken in a sunny-looking marlow earlier today by bbc weather watcher 'michael 's view ' .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: axe-attack boyfriend went on the run after almost killing former partner
text: a man found guilty of the attempted murder of his former partner with an axe went on the run for two-and-a-half weeks before he was eventually arrested and charged .
arshad latif , 34 , of haydon road , aylesbury , was today sentenced at reading crown court to 20 years in prison .

investigating officer , det con jayne green , from the domestic abuse investigation unit at aylesbury police station , said : there is no doubt latif could have killed his former partner as this case demonstrates , domestic abuse can have devastating consequences . ''

documents.title: milton keynes will have new secondary school after council grants planning permission
text: plans for a new secondary school in kents hill , milton keynes , have been approved by milton keynes council , despite it being labelled 'inherently barmy ' .
author: One MK

documents.title: evening headlines : axe attacker sentenced to 20 years pcc candidates announced
text: the latest headlines are :

documents.title: police given special powers to counter edl protest
text: thames valley police say it is planning a `` comprehensive operation '' to counter a planned protest by the english defence league and counter-demonstrations in high wycombe tomorrow .

officers have been authorised under the criminal justice and public order act 1994 to insist people remove any item , which the officer believes that person is wearing wholly or mainly for the purpose of concealing their identity .
anyone failing to comply will be committing a criminal offence .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: candidates for thames valley police and crime commissioner
text: the candidates for the police and crime commissioner 's position in thames valley have been announced .
they are current commissioner conservative anthony stansfeld ( labour 's laetisia carter , john howson from the liberal democrats and ukip 's lea trainer .
the election will take place on 5 may .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: luton town plan to bring in former forest boss paul hart
text: luton town manager nathan jones hopes to recruit former nottingham forest boss paul hart to work alongside him at kenilworth road .
hart , 62 , became leeds academy director last september , but left elland road earlier this month .
jones , who worked with hart at charlton athletic , said he was someone he has always gone to for advice , adding : `` he 's been a bit of a mentor for me .
if there 's a possibility that we can do something then that would be a really good addition to our team . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: aylesbury man sentenced to 20 years for axe attack
text: a man from aylesbury who attacked his former partner with an axe has been sentenced at reading crown court to 20 years in prison for attempted murder .
arshad latif , 34 , from haydon road , was also sentenced to a further five years on licence once released .
he carried out the attack in the early hours of 16 august last year .
his 29-year-old victim was left with a gash on her neck , cuts on her back and broken ribs .

documents.title: candidates named for hertfordshire police and crime commisioner election
text: the candidates for the police and crime commissioner 's job in hertfordshire have been announced .
they are serving commissioner conservative david lloyd , mark hughes of ukip , kerry pollard from labour and liberal democrat chris white .
the election will take place on 5 may .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: dons prepare for vital rotherham clash
text: mk dons boss karl robinson is likely to rotate his squad against rotherham , who are six points ahead of their hosts as the two clubs battle against relegation from the championship .
attacking players such as dean bowditch , jay emmanuel-thomas , and alex revell are among those robinson could bring in on saturday .

documents.title: watch : dashcam footage reveals how police officers chased autistic man
text: this is the moment police officers christopher thomas and christopher pitts spot faruk ali , a severely autistic man with the mental age of a five-year-old .
he 's watching the weekly bin collection across the corner from his house .
pc pitts spins the car around and mr ali starts running for home .
you can hear his colleague encouraging him to after mr ali with the words : `` go on , go , go '' .
the two bedfordshire police officers were sacked after being found guilty of gross misconduct yesterday .
author: Nicola Haseler
BBC Three Counties

documents.title: suspected illegal immigrants found at motorway service station
text: thirteen suspected illegal immigrants have been given medical treatment after being found in the back of a lorry at the northbound toddington services on the m1 .
bedfordshire police were called to the service at 12:45 , along with the ambulance service .

documents.title: weather : sunshine and showers
text: we should see a mixture of sunshine and scattered showers this afternoon .
any showers will die away to leave a dry evening and later in the night cloud will thicken with rain arriving as it progresses .
the maximum temperature will be 12c ( 53f ) .
our is of a bright-looking milton keynes and was posted to bbc weather watchers by user 'mknicki ' .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pub landlord claims bridge closure has cost him £ 20,000
text: a pub landlord in biggleswade says he has lost £ 20,000 in revenue due to a bridge closure .
alex shipton , who runs the red lion pub next to stratton bridge , says he 's now facing a further £ 12,000 in lost business after work to reopen the main thoroughfare was put back until june .
central bedfordshire council and network rail , which is carrying out the work , have blamed bad weather for the delays .
author: Justin Dealey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: faruk ali case : police video captured autistic man crying for his mother
text: a video from the dashboard camera of pc christopher pitts and pc christopher thomas 's police car caught the moment they chased autistic faruk ali in luton in 2014 .
at some point , pc thomas got out of the car , grabbed mr ali and threw him into some wheelie bins .
he said he had chased him as he was running away from a police car and could have been a burglar .
the video captured the sound of mr ali calling for his mother as he ran away .
the two policemen were yesterday sacked by bedfordshire police for gross misconduct .

documents.title: behrami available for hornets for trip to everton
text: watford have no fresh injury concerns for the visit of everton tomorrow .
midfielder valon behrami is available again after missing last week 's defeat at arsenal due to illness .
everton midfielder gareth barry returns after missing his side 's last two matches due to suspension .

documents.title: dunstable downs will remain open despite travellers ' arrival
text: dunstable downs will remain open as usual despite the arrival of a group of travellers .
the group had been moved on from court drive in the town .
a spokesman for the national trust confirmed the travellers had set up in one of the car parks at the downs .

documents.title: latest headlines : complaints commission back sacking of beds police officers travellers move to dunstable downs
text: these are the headlines this afternoon :

documents.title: woburn safari park bear cubs prepare to meet rest of the family
text: three super-cute baby bears will remain in their pen with mum phoenix until they are old enough to meet the rest of the animals that will make up their community at woburn safari park ; 12-year-old dad xanthos , eight other black bears and four canadian timber wolves .
the cubs , which were too small to climb back into their six foot-high tree den after venturing out , have been built a ground-level home , complete with extra straw and plenty of fish and fruit .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: nominations for next bedfordshire police and crime commissioner finalised
text: the nominations for the next police and crime commissioner for bedfordshire have been formally entered .

the candidates are toni bugle of the english democrats , conservative kathryn holloway , linda jack from the liberal democrats , ukip 's duncan strachan and current commissioner olly martins ( the labour and co-operative party candidate .
the election will take place on may 5 .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: faruk ali case : officers ' behaviour 'highlights need to treat vulnerable people with respect '
text: the treatment of autistic faruk ali , who has the mental age of a five-year-old , in luton in 2014 by two police officers `` highlights the continuing need for police to treat vulnerable people with the dignity and respect they deserve , '' according to the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) .
bedfordshire police pcs christopher thomas and christopher pitts ( yesterday for gross misconduct .

ipcc commissioner mary cunneen said the case showed why officers `` should be held to account for their actions '' , adding `` there is no place in policing for the shocking behaviour exhibited by these officers '' .

documents.title: dunstable travellers say they 'll move back into the town if evicted from the downs
text: travellers forced to move from a site in court drive , dunstable have relocated to dunstable downs .
this morning one of the travellers told me that if moved on again , they planned to go back to the centre of dunstable .
and , he added , they would continue to find somewhere else to move to until a permanent site was arranged .
the above shows litter at the vacated court drive site .
author: Sophie Sulehria
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: dunstable travellers ' site 'will take at least a day to clear up '
text: i 've been down to the site in court drive , dunstable , vacated by a group of travellers , who have now moved to dunstable downs .
there is human excrement here and what looks like vomit , along with lots and lots of rubbish - although some of it has been bagged up .
there is a whole load of wood , which looks like it was left over from some kind of job .
the whole thing is absolutely disgusting .
it will take at least a day to clear up .
author: Jonathan Vernon-Smith
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: rubbish dumped as travellers leave dunstable site
text: this is how the court drive travellers ' site in dunstable looks now after a group of travellers were ordered to move on and left the area .
they had faced an eviction order from central bedfordshire council .
yesterday , cliff codona from the national travellers action group had told the bbc that travellers in bedfordshire were in urgent need of more permanent sites .

documents.title: faruk ali case : sacked police officers heard mocking autistic man
text: two police officers sacked for their treatment of autistic man , faruk ali ( in luton in 2014 laughed about him after they got back in their vehicle .
a dashboard camera up the officers saying : `` welcome to bury park '' and `` [ he ] does n't interact with people , do n't let him out '' .
mr ali 's brother , dhobir ali , said : `` faruk is a vulnerable person and to laugh at him and particularly the comment they used knowing faruk had a disability , that in itself is shocking . ''

documents.title: triple trouble bear cubs discovered in oak tree den at woburn safari park
text: three bear cubs born at woburn safari park were discovered hiding in an oak tree .
keepers knew there was at least one cub as they had heard calls to their mother , four-year-old phoenix , coming from a large den in the tree .
but they were shocked when the as-yet unsexed triplets ventured outside for the first time over easter .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: faruk ali case : brother of autistic man says sacked police officers ' behaviour was 'disgusting '
text: the brother of an autistic man , who was mocked by two police officers as they chased him down the road , says he was `` shocked '' when he saw a video of the incident .

pcs christopher thomas and christopher pitts were sacked after yesterday being found guilty of gross misconduct over their treatment of faruk ali , who has the mental age of a five-year-old , in luton in 2014 .
dhobir ali said : `` i could not believe a police officer would do such a thing .
it 's disgusting . ''

documents.title: bear cub triplets born at woburn safari park
text: a trio of north american black bear cubs has been born at woburn safari park .
the cubs , the first to be born at the bedfordshire park in 18 years , are sure to have the `` aww '' factor for visitors .
the park 's acting head of carnivores , craig lancaster , said the new arrivals have been `` behaving like ty young babies - sleeping for long periods of time , playing together and suckling '' .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: man accused of muppet protest due in court
text: a man is due to appear before magistrates today following a protest at stevenage police station .
the man is accused of climbing onto the roof of the station last december dressed as the muppet character elmo from sesame street .
the 33-year-old from anderson road , stevenage has been charged with aggravated trespass .

documents.title: faruk ali case : 'we do n't have a culture problem , ' insists senior beds police officer
text: bedfordshire police does not have a `` culture problem , '' according to the force 's deputy chief constable .
mark collins was speaking after two officers , pcs christopher thomas and christopher pitts , were yesterday sacked for gross misconduct over their handling of a case involving autistic faruk ali .
mr collins said the force has a `` very close working relationship '' with the asian community , which would be `` reassured by the positive action we have taken '' .

documents.title: weather : brightening up after a chilly start
text: it will be a chilly start to the day with some rural fog around , but this will clear quickly as the skies brighten up during the morning .
the day will then be a mix of sunshine and scattered showers .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
our was taken in stopsely and was posted on bbc weather watchers by user 'newworldhasopened ' .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : 'no culture problem ' in bedfordshire police bear cubs born at woburn safari park
text: these are the latest headlines this morning :

documents.title: travel : traffic queuing on the m1 due a broken-down car
text: there is severe disruption on the m1 after j11 for the a505 dunstable road in bedfordshire .
one lane is closed and there is heavy traffic due to a broken-down car .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live stream for the three counties .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , weather and travel from across bedfordshire , hetfordshire and buckinghamshire .

yesterday 's big news - the sacking of two bedfordshire police officers after they were found guilty of gross misconduct over the way they dealt with a man who has autism - is still making headlines and we 'll bring you plenty of reaction to that .
but first , we 've got some weather and travel news coming your way .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News
